revised_title: Determining the Obliquity of the Ecliptic and the Maximum of the Aberration of Light
tldr: This article discusses the results of observations made at Trinity College Observatory in Dublin to determine the obliquity of the ecliptic and the maximum of the aberration of light. The author, J. Brinkley, compares early observations with the present ones and refers to the difference in opinions of other astronomers. He also highlights the importance of paying attention to observations at the winter solstice and provides a table of the mean obliquity reduced to January 1813.
